channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for IA

item.title: Report E-2023030490
item.description:
Report E-2023030490

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-03T13:57:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-03-16
  • City: SIOUX CITY
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At 0956 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal XSC. It was reported that approximately 1 cup of UN3266 Cir Kleen No. 265 was released from a 55-gallon plastic drum. The release impacted the inside of trailer #3112327. ERTS dispatched a contractor to the site to complete cleanup activities. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-cup of product released to a 4' x 4' area of the trailer floor due to a damaged/fault cap. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted area. The damaged drum and cleanup debris was collected into a 95-gallon poly over pack. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

Report E-2023030448

  • City: DES MOINES
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one case of urethane sealer (un1263) had been damaged by a sharp object and that 2 of the inner metal one gallons had released 1 gallon of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.
